required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multimodal Exercise Program in Musculoskeletal System of the Community Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: A Multimodal Exercise Program in Musculoskeletal System of the Community Elderly

brief_summary.textblock: The number of elderly has been increasing in recent decades. Current studies focused on the risk factors of poor physical performance, poor daily activity performance, and even disability in the elderly. We planned to evaluate the physical performance of elderly dwelling in the community and designed a multimodal exercise program which can improve physical performance, prevent disability and promote quality of life.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: intervention group: receive multimodal exercise program for half year control group: participate community activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain, stiffness, physical function of knee
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points (baseline, 3 months later)
secondary_outcome.description: WOMAC (Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index) questionnaire is used for evaluation of pain, stiffness, physical function of patients with knee osteoarthritis. It includes 5 questions for pain, 2 questions for stiffness and 17 questions for physical function. The score of every question is from 0 to 4. The larger the number, the discomfort becomes more servere. We use the difference of change between two time points (baseline, 3 months later) to measure the benefit of the exercise.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain, stiffness, physical function of knee
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time points (baseline, 6 months later)
secondary_outcome.description: WOMAC (Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index) questionnaire is used for evaluation of pain, stiffness, physical function of patients with knee osteoarthritis. It includes 5 questions for pain, 2 questions for stiffness and 17 questions for physical function. The score of every question is from 0 to 4. The larger the number, the discomfort becomes more servere. We use the difference of change between two time points (baseline, 6 months later) to measure the benefit of the exercise.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time (baseline, 3 months later)
secondary_outcome.description: measure grip strength by Camry EH101

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change between two time (baseline, 6 months later)
secondary_outcome.description: measure grip strength by Camry EH101

arm_group.description: Elderly in this group will receive multimodal exercise program. The duration of exercise is 60 minutes and frequency is 2 times/week.
Elderly in this group will continue to attend community activity as usual. The activity includes active activity is 60 minutes and frequency is 2 times/week.

intervention.description: warm-up, strengthening exercise, aerobic exercise, cool-down

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >= 65 year old
Exclusion Criteria:
- cognitive impairment and poor understanding for orders
- the elderly has medical problems that the elderly can't perform exercise

overall_official.affiliation: Chang Gung Medical Foundation Institutional Review Board
